title: How to Prepare Your Family for a Natural Disaster

steps.headline: Take an emergency preparedness course.
steps.description: Some of the best ones are offered at local community and technical colleges. Discuss it with family members.

steps.headline: Keep a basic first aid kit on hand at all times.
steps.description: Make sure you order snake venom and bee venom treatments, as well.

steps.headline: Store one gallon of water per person and pet per day.
steps.description: Keep at least three-day supply of water for each person and pet available. Water is vital.

steps.headline: Have a water purification method ready to go.
steps.description: A few ideas are boiling your water, having a water disinfectant, or a filtration system. Boiling is the most preferred way to kill viruses, bacteria, and parasites. This is followed closely by disinfectants - such as unscented household bleach or chlorine dioxide tablets - and purification filters. The filters are handy to have for those times when you need to be on-the-go.

steps.headline: Have a supply of imperishable food.
steps.description: Be sure that you keep enough food stored for at least three meals per day per person and pet for a minimum of three days. Be sure to keep cooking utensils, plastic-ware, paper plates, paper towels, and a manual can opener handy.

steps.headline: Keep an alternate cooking source - such as a charcoal grill or a camp stove - nearby.
steps.description: You never know when you will need it.

steps.headline: Make sure that you have basic camping and emergency supplies: flashlights, extra batteries, extra prescription medications, battery- or solar-powered radio, cell phone and its charger, fire extinguisher, and matches.
steps.description: Extra blankets and clothes are also essential.

steps.headline: Keep important documents and a secret stash of currency or other bartering items.
steps.description: Keep your birth certificates, passports, marriage licenses, mortgage paperwork, car titles, insurance cards and vaccination records, family contact information, house and car keys, and debit cards and cash.
